Reviews.Title: “Clean, easy location for mainland, no extras if using points”
Reviews.Author: Tana C
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay if you want to be off of the island of Venice. Buses are a little walk aways, great local restraunt nearby and a fresh market and small store a short drive or longer walk. Everything was very clean and staff (minus one lady) were very helpful. Negatives: The elevators are very very tiny and if you are using points you get no aminities. Most places we have used points still give the same aminities (free breakfast, free internet service) to us when we travel. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Glo F
Reviews.Content: although this hotel is a bit out of the way the shuttle bus was excellent. The room was more spacious than expected and the breakfast buffet was quite good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: This was one of our nicer hotels during our holiday. Rooms were spacious and clean. Opened window for ventilation. Had dinner in the hotel restaurant and it was quite good. Although this hotel is outside of Venice, I would recommend if you'd like a better rate than in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: Nikki C
Reviews.Content: I found the Holiday Inn to be very comfortable and clean. The staff was very helpful with every question I had. It is about a 10 minute walk to the town's little center, which has bars, restaurants, and a grocery store. The hotel's shuttle to Venice is efficient and relatively inexpensive at 8 euros round trip. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: BrooksJapan
Reviews.Content: Well it is outside Venice but it is cheaper to stay out in Mestre. The hotel was fine. It was in a residential area, and was quiet. Venice was kind of cold, but it has been a cold winter. The only problem was the key card. It was kind of hard to open the door to the room. One guest told me to turn to the left but an Italian told me to turn to the right, and the door opened.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location away from venice”
Reviews.Author: Faryal A
Reviews.Content: During our visit to Venice, we stayed at this hotel which is 13 kms from Mraco polo airport and 1.5 km to Venice Mestre rail station. We went there in March last year. The lobby was deserted but there were some magazines and newspaper to browse while the paperwork was being completed. The lady receptionist was a very friendly person and greeted us with a warm smile. She gave us a map of the city and marked the places where we wanted to go. The rooms were nice and neat. This is one feature, we donot compromise on. The bathroom was small but neat. However, while taking a shower, we found that the slope of the bathtub was not designed properly, resulting in water passing from the rim of the tub right down the floor. It was quite uncomfortable and left a mess in the bathroom. We informed the hotel staff about it and I hope they have fixed the bathroom by now. There was a well equipped mini gym in the hotel. The breakfast was good and pretty decent. If the bathroom was working properly, the hotel would have been given a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: noorbitar
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located quite far from the center of Venice; where all the sightseeing is. Rooms were clean and spacious. Manager at the reception was very rude and not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Could not recall but was decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexander G
Reviews.Content: During my two-week tour around Western Europe, I had a stopover in Venice where I stayed at this Holiday Inn hotel off the island. Although it was somewhat run-down, the room was comfortable enough and one could choose from a selection of pillows, and this being the first full-fledged Holiday Inn hotel I've stayed at I'm quite impressed with this tiny but important feature. Sleeping was okay too. My experience was extremely vague and we were with a tour. Apparently the prices now are SGD102 - 178, and it's a bit over the top but fair enough.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: ishouldcocouk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here in October 2011. The location is just off the autoroute and Mestre is very industrialised, so it's not exactly picturesque but we were well-prepared so weren't disappointed. The aircon didn't work especially well though (temperature probably set centrally) so we had to sleep with the window open. Whilst checking in, I happened to ask directions to the car park for the Fusina ferry. Cue hard sell on the Holiday Inn minibus to Venice (I think 12 euros each) because 'the car parks are VERY expensive'. Well, I get sick on coaches so that was out anyway but it turned out that terminal Fusina (sounds way grander than it actually is!) was only about a 15-20 minute drive and it really wasn't that much more expensive than the minibus for car parking and the ferry tickets - I think 32 euros in total. And much nicer to arrive in Venice by boat! You need to check the timetable beforehand though as we missed one boat by literally 10 seconds and then had to wait an hour for the next one. It was sunny though and a woman thoughtfully decided to sunbathe topless behind us, to my husband's delight, so the hour passed quite pleasantly ...! My top tip? Look in tourist information offices as we (the day after!) found a Terminal Fusina voucher for a 6 euro discount each. There is an Auchan hypermarket not too far from the hotel and we bought an excellent cooked chicken and fries there for a fraction of the cost of eating in a restaurant. Stretched my non-existent Italian to the limit but a lot of smiling and gesticulating won the day!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Barry L
Reviews.Content: This is the poorest Holiday Inn that i have experienced. The property is very tired with average rooms. Breakfast not great. On the positive side it is very easy to access Venice via a hotel shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, arrogant, and ignorant staff! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: tgsh2007
Reviews.Content: First of all let me make clear that this property has the potential to be an excellent hotel. The rooms, although on the small side, are comfortable, clean, and well appointed. On this basis I had no issues whatever. That being said the level of service and staff attitude were both atrocious! As a Priority Club Platinum member I book all my IHG hotels through the PC website. Therefore I rely on accurate descriptions to enable me to make an informed choice of where to stay. Problem number one, the location. Contrary to the website, which states 1.4 KM from Venice Mestre train station, this hotel is around 4 or 5 KM from the station. Buses DO NOT run regularly. And even if you take the bus a 10 minute walk is then required. A taxi for this short journey will cost you between â‚¬16 and â‚¬20! Problem number two, the internet. This service is provided by Vodafone and the Hotel has no input (apparently). Only available to guests able to use specific CREDIT cards. No debit cards acceptable (no reason given, just the way it is). Therefore if you don't have (or wish to use) a credit card then the perfectly reasonable alternative of a VISA debit card is useless. This form of payment is accepted all around the world, but not by Vodafone Italy (apparently). Hotel was not interested. They should clearly state on the website that they DO NOT provide a hotel based wireless service and that this is only provided by a 3rd party accepting limited methods of payment. One could then elect to stay elsewhere! Simple! Now the staff attitude. This was horrendous! Arrogant and ignorant comes to mind! I asked for the name and/or email address of the General Manager. Apparently I was not entitled to this information. All complaints had to be raised via duty manager who would pass the matter on. Obviously the General Manager in this hotel is far too grand to deal with the "common" customer! How pathetic! Breakfast time and not one member of staff could be found in the breakfast area! When one eventually turned up she was most upset that a customer who had been waiting nearly 15 minutes was annoyed! Checkout was equally a pantomime! The Duty Manager who was manning the reception (only member of staff on reception incidentally) was most 'anxious' to announce quite loudly that my payment card was "NOT GOOD". Apparently he had tried to charge it for the full stay and incidentals 2 hours earlier that morning (without me first checking the bill). Supposedly it was declined! I gave him the exact same card and, surprise surprise, it was absolutely fine! The point here being that this supposed experienced member of staff was content to state a customer's card was being declined in the sight and hearing of other customers, and not to deal with the matter discreetly. I should say that for getting into Venice itself the hotel provides a shuttle service several times daily. This must be pre booked and costs â‚¬8. The service was actually quite efficient. Gold/Platinum members of Priority Club should expect ABSOLUTELY NOTHING by way of recognition from this property. Overall this is not a suitable property if location is important. Also, those not willing to accept the "Fawlty Towers" style service should really look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: PML2011
Reviews.Content: Clean, great location, great Value.. Perfect for a day in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: GPAB
Reviews.Content: We were put here by Cosmos after our Greece Tour was cancelled due to safety concerns brought about by the recent condition in Greece. They said it was an upgrade, but no! I don't think so! The hotel is old, dirty and bad breakfast. Just wondering why it was classified as four star???

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Pity about the location”
Reviews.Author: freddo56
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. Staff were run off their feet with bus tours checking in a lot. No Internet except for one computer for the public to use. Difficult to navigate how to get to Venice itself at first. There is a shuttle bus to and from the hotel which you have to book in advance. It costs 8 euro return for one person. We caught the local bus which cost 1.30 each way.. A 10 min walk at the back of the hotel but we wanted to experience a bit of the local life. Nice pizzeria cafe a block away at back of hotel also. Train station not far but can't walk it as it's obstructed by the freeway. Taxi fare from Mestre train station is 15 euro. Or bus at back of hotel takes you for 1.30 euro. Overall good value as hotels in Venice itself are very pricey. Food is really cheap on the island surprisingly enough. Lots of competition I expect.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Bargain !”
Reviews.Author: jaimin21
Reviews.Content: Very good service along with knowledgeable English speaking staff, they have a shuttle that drives you to Venice pretty frequently for a very nominal charge. Breakfast is decent (obviously not comparable to the ones on US)....i did not try to restaurant but i heard from the other guests that is quite decent food.....overall, a good value for money if you do not want to overpay living in some bad hotels in Venice !!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal position for venice”
Reviews.Author: raytaximan
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back ,21/09 /11, On arrival given our room, top floor, window would not open, informed reception. within 7 minuets we wer'e given another room, excellent service. Like other visitor's, use the shuttle service to venice ,a bargain @ 8 euro's trouble free. Breakfast,self service ,plenty of it, if it is wrong it's your fault, The restaurant on the Evenings, if there are 3/4 coach parties in the hotel, you will find yourself waiting to be served, (not an ideal Situation).when you pay a lot of money Overall the staff, the rooms the service all very very good, which made our stay in Venice pleasurable Must Visit's Murano. Burano, Lido all three Brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Rooms good but not a normal holiday inn.”
Reviews.Author: Beropol
Reviews.Content: Over all the location of hotel is great for a visit to Venice and the shuttle service provided by the hotel is well worth the money as it makes your day trip into the city easy. Book early to get the best times for a full day. Most of the other negative comments you read about the hotel are a little over the top with the exception of the restaurant which is at least to say over priced and lacking in any sort of style. The food was unimaginative and a take it or leave it attitude a d if you only want a main course they will surcharge you. One other point if you want to post card from reception don't we left two for posting one of which arrived 30 day later and only after we complained the other well who know's where that is as it has never arrived to date.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: SWchauffeurman
Reviews.Content: As a priority club member and having stayed in a number of Holiday Inns throughout the UK and Europe I feel compelled to write as this hotel is far from the generally excellent experiences we have had elsewhere. If this hotel is operated under licence then it needs to be revoked. When we checked in the staff on the desk looked miserable and bored and made you feel you were interupting their conversation and invading their private time - at 4pm. The decor was dated, even my Great Grandmother had better taste than the standard of the interior design. When asked at reception about the laundry we got fobbed off with some excuse about staff being away. You are meant to be a 4 star hotel, what do you expect me to do - turn my pants inside out!! I am no chef but I am pretty sure that Pizza is not meant to be flooded with water! Was all the topping made from frozen ingredients? When I went to eat the thing all the topping fell off because is was so soggy and made it look like a pile of vomit that had been plonked on the plate - not even a starving African would eat that. Both dinner and breakfast was an organised abomination, a real dogs dinner! Could not recommend this Holiday Inn to my worst enemy - it in no way represents the Holiday Inn brand - Intercontinental Hotel Group take note!!!!! ps The shuttle service to Venice is now 8 Euros per person, and is about the only service that is reliable and efficient. Probably because it is provided by an outside contractor!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: Hakim17
Reviews.Content: The pros : Great room, confortable, clean. Good service. The cons : Breakfast not included. Far away from downtown Mestre and the bus to Venice wasn't so frequent. Avoid it if you don't go there by car.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Rockbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, in a room at the front of the building. Traffic noise wasn't a problem and the room was quite large and comfortable. Bathroom was nicely fitted, clean and modern. Staff were vague at times but mostly helpful, depending on which staff member was on duty. The food was standard quality and breakfast was ample, although the scrambled eggs tasted like they were from a packet. A free computer is available at reception, right on the reception desk, but was always in use during our visit. If you stay on a lower floor it's easier to take the stairs instead of the lift, as there was quite often a lengthy delay during our stay, due to bus loads of guests arriving. The gym is below reception level, small and dark, until you find the light switch, and I wasn't keen on visiting by myself as it was so isolated. The service station out front provided general items such as snacks and alcohol. Overall I would say this is a three star hotel and it provides everything you would expect of such an establishment.

Reviews.Title: “One of your average, decent hotels. Not the best.”
Reviews.Author: amyhua
Reviews.Content: Nothing really to complain about this hotel. I'm not sure about the price because it was a part of a tour deal type thing. It was one of your average hotels that are okay for a night. Nothing special. Just a regular hotel. Had air conditioning, which was great. Otherwise, the breakfast was not so good. Only stayed for a night. The hotel room was kind of clean. Also since it was a tour, transportation to the port where the boats were to take us to Venice was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't...”
Reviews.Author: zizo_q8
Reviews.Content: This was a bad experience from th beginning till the end.. the service,the treatment.. it was a big mess... have u ever heard about room service that doesn't reply to ur calls.. you'll see that in this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: BillK045
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although clean, provides very poor service. They advertize Wi-Fi in the rooms but don't have it and don't apologize for not having it. I was told that the provider (Vodaphone) had not been very good so the hotel had stopped the service. Their version of HSIA is a workstation at the front desk which is so slow it could be dialup. The front desk staff were rude, not just to me, but to others also. The restaurant staff were pleasant without going the extra mile for the guests and the food was very good but service was slower than even Italian standards allows for. They offer a shuttle from the hotel to Piazzale Roma in Venice at a cost of 8 Euros per person (return) but the shuttle only has 6 or 7 seats and, even though you have to book in advance, they still managed to overbook it on numerous occasions. There is the option to go to into Venice on a local bus but the staff were not forward about letting people know that. There was no provision to be able to give guests written directions to anywhere or any thing. My impression was that this hotel has gone into liquidation and is being managed on a shoestring. I spoke with a local person while I was there and he intimated that it was in the control of local government. Whatever the situation, this is one of the worst Holiday Inns you'll ever come across. However, it is inexpensive at 90 Euros per night (including breakfast) and the room was clean so it may suit someone on a low budget who isn't too bothered about internet access or local transportation. If you go by car, parking is plentiful but costs 8 Euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Venice - Holiday Inn Mestre Marghera”
Reviews.Author: Vickie089
Reviews.Content: Hotel was about 10/15 minutes by van away from the main ferry service to Venice and then another 30/45 minutes on the ferry to San Marco Square. Hotel was very old, internet was down and even though we are Platinum members of the Holiday Inn, they refused to give us free breakfast that we always receive. Hotel was clean, front desk staff was just okay. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. They only had 6 irons for the entire hotel and after we got one, they took it out of our room without telling us and we had to wait for a day to get another one. We are Marriott Gold Members and are treated like royalty. It meant nothing to them that we were Platinum Members. Hotel is about 10 minutes from the Mestre Station, that was convenient enough, but that was about all it was convenient to. Our room overlooked the gas station in front of the hotel. Not our idea of what a view of Venice would be like. It was a mistake on our part to pick this hotel. If we ever go back, we will be sure to stay om the Island of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brand Name, Not Management”
Reviews.Author: slustooge
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. The hotel was in a difficult location to figure out how to get to from the Mestre Train Station. The hotel website says to take a bus 2 stops (its really 5) and walk. Since the hotel was only 1.9 km from the station we took a taxi, which surprised us by costing 15 Euros. One big reason we chose this hotel, was the shuttle to Venice. Its not free. Price is 32 Euros for a couple roundtrip per day. We asked the desk worker of any alternatives. We were handed a map and given no instruction on the bus. Takes about 10 mins to walk to. I asked why the hotel was not up to the Holiday Inn standards and the worker said quote â€œthis is just a brand name, not Holiday Inn management.â€� I did not appreciate his condescending response to my query. The room was hot, so we set the thermostat at full cool (8 C) and left for sightseeing the remainder of the day. The high of the day was only 17 degrees Celsius, but the thermostat read a stifling 27 degrees Celsius at 10pm. Our third floor room faced the highway, so opening the window to cool down the room resulted in a very loud and disruptive nights sleep. Just wanted to spend 2 mins on the internet to check my flight status, but cheapest access is 5 Euros. The toilet ran all night. We chose to stay outside of Venice to save money. But the amount of time/hassle to get there, poor service and room quality plus the nickel and diming of this Holiday Inn, made our stay regretful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: miller_jonathan53
Reviews.Content: I absulotely recommed this hotel. The rooms are very nice and the stuff was too kind.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: enagar
Reviews.Content: located conveniently close to venice and train station make it an ideal cost effective place to stay on your trip to venice. the room service was good, but the hotel closes quite early before 9pm. downside... the hotel did not have double beds and did not care to change us the next day into a room that has a double bed. so me and my spouse had to sleep on separate beds with a cliff separating us on our romantic venetian get away. their internet was also not working inspite of advertizing in a big way that it is sponsored by vodafone another downside is that unlike most hotels in the outskirts, it did not have a swimming pool and its fitness center was also too small. so in short it is a no frill budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Pris11
Reviews.Content: As a part of a group going to Venice, I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel Marghera for two nights. The hotel is barely a 3 starts hotel, neither the amenities nor the service provided meet what is expected of a 4 start hotel. The beds were comfortable enough, but the shower stall had mold, the amenities could be described as basic. The location is right of a highway, not much around, but a local pizzeria nearby was the redeeming quality.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: rennaissance
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to groups; when there are no groups there, it goes to sleep It go. I used the internet at the lobby. It gobbled my euros and came back empty after a few minutes. After spending 30 euros I quit. The hotel is in the middle of no where. Very expensive and lousy food. So-so service. Altogether a bad dream

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, very helpful, compassionate staff”
Reviews.Author: nanamc
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves at this hotel after being denied permission to board our Cruise in Venice (and that is another story!). We arived in the early evening after the Pier Supervisor booked a room for us. The hotel is about 20 minutes outside of Venice and we travelled from the pier by taxi and paid around 35 Euros for the trip. Needless to say we were upset and needing to contact family, friends and our Travel Insurance company back home in Australia. The front desk Manager, Ms Sylvia L was absolutely wonderful! She allowed us to use the hotel's office computer so we had some privacy and later in the evening provided us with some milk as the service station next door was closed. Our room was nice - it had a huge king size bed, a decent sized bathroom and tea and coffee making facilities which we really appreciated. Our rate included breakfast which was good with reasonable choice and there is a bar in the foyer area that makes a good strong cup of coffee. We found the internet to be slow and expensive which was annoying as we needed to use it due to our predicament. There is a shuttle bus provided by the Hotel which you need to book at around 7.5 euro per person. We stayed 2 nights and found the staff polite, but not quite as helpful as Ms Sylvia who was a real treasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, distant place to stay outside of Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGrandmaToo
Reviews.Content: Getting there: We took the 3-Euro express bus from airport to Ple. Roma, then took a taxi ($35) to the hotel in the industrial park area of Mestre, across the causeway from old Venice. Curt desk personnel. Simple but serviceable room and bath w/tub-shower. You have to schedule their shuttle back to Ple. Roma (7 E per person each way, but far cheaper than a taxi), then you can either walk over the bridge to the city center or take a water taxi (6.50). No breakfast included, but we got the room free with Priority Club points, so we were able to put some milk in the little fridge and enjoy some breakfast snacks in our room. Taxi to airport at 4:30 a.m. was a flat $35. Had the room cost us, it may have been easier and cheaper just to stay somewhere near the railway station with easy access to the airport and Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and rude reception staff”
Reviews.Author: snowyjojo
Reviews.Content: We happily checked in the hotel and found out that the room door lock wasn't function properly. Called the reception to feedback on this and was told... "It's SAFE to stay in the room if the door cannot be opened from outside", "You could keep your important belongings in the safe. Otherwise you can also bring your stuff to the reception and we would keep for you.". I asked the staff to send someone to my room to fix the lock and he told me nobody to do that at 9pm. So I demanded to have a change of room and the staff said the hotel was full and no more room. I was very frustrated. Shouldn't the hotel make sure that everything is alright before renting out the room? He even yelled at me thru phone, sounded like "take it? or leave it!" Whats more, he hung up the phone!! Geez.. After 10 mins, one of the staff came and said that we could change to another room. Mind you, the room number is 444. To my surprise, no room 10 mins ago and 10 mins later, 1 empty room was available with the room number 444!! Would you like to change?? The staff seriously need to be re-trained - bad service and bad etiquette. Luckily just stayed for a night. Will avoid this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Aobisi
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to stay here and do your day tour as this hotel is out of nowhere. Breakfast is the usual bacon, scramble egg and sausages. Room is averagely comfy but old looking. Shower room is quite small and the water drainage is slow, causing flooding in the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: dshep
Reviews.Content: This was what I would expect from the chain - fairly impersonal, but clean and confortable. Dinner and breakfast were fine. The location has been commented on - and it is a way away. However a 25 min walk takes you to the Mestre railway station (ask the daytime reception - not the 'night staff' - for directions on a (free) map and you should be okay; you start out the hotel door, turn left along the drive and you will find a pedestrian entrance on your right, go through here and turn left, walk to the end of the street and turn left - and you are on your way! (If you email me, I might even still be able to give you the street names!) You also come across a supermarket on a roundabout on the way which is useful). If the hotel don't help, you can buy a street map from the petrol station for 7 Euros. The train costs 1 euro into Venice (terminus) and you walk out of the station and onto the Grand Canal! Trains clean and reliable - make sure when going back that you get off at Mestre (and not Marghera which is just before it). Buy a 12 hour card from the tourist info on the station for unlimited use on all waterbuses (cost 16 Euro) where a single trip costs 6.50 Euro - we went up and down the Grand Canal twice and also round the outside of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “After 23:00 (11pm) you will not be able to get any food at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer-eg
Reviews.Content: I would like to warn people that this hotel is in a remote location with no restaurants around with in miles. I was jet lagged and woke up after midnight and was needing some food as I had slept most of the day. I called reception to find out that there is NO FOOD available at this hotel at all after 23:00 (11:00pm). There is only one staff member in the entire hotel and he's at the front desk and does not have access to anything. They don't even have a Vending machine. I will avoid this hotel at all cost in the future!

Reviews.Title: “normal chain hotel, horrible location”
Reviews.Author: chicocussiano
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you can expect from a chain hotel: clean and confortable. the only set back, and it was a big one, is its location. In the end the difference me and my family have spent on taxis to go in and out of Venice would pay us a similar hotel in Venice itself. there was a shuttle service to venice, but the time table was ridiculous and prices were 14â‚¬ for the return trip!!! Unless you're in a excursion bus and has no option you should avoid this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel once you make it here”
Reviews.Author: Samyukth
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is good. But it can be pricey to get from the hotel to train station (Venezia Mestre)- cab takes about 15 euros, although it is 1.9 kms away. We decided to walk to the hotel from the train station- WORST decision of my life. It took us 1.5 hours and we got terribly lost. The hotel operates a shuttle from the hotel to main Venice (7 euros per couple one way, takes 10 mins). If you there for 2 of days, thats 28 euros. Bus no. 6 comes close to the hotel from Venice, but its not ideal. The one thing which made our stay worth it was Franco, the manger on duty at night. He was very helpful and polite. The other manager (another youngish guy) was totally misinforming us- telling us that there was no bus to the airport from the train station (there is Ryan air bus 5 euros each), telling us there was no way to get back to hotel after 11pm except taxi (you can take no. 6 and walk 10 mins), telling us the hotel did not book taxis to the train station (Franco did, the previous night) etc. In short, Franco is the guy and the other dude was either new or just dumb. We chose this because it worked out to be a lot cheaper than hotels in Venice (used priceline). I would probably go back to this hotel if I were visiting Venice. However, if you are only in Venice for one day, this may not be the best choice. 2 days min. advised.

Reviews.Title: “Straightforward access to Venice. Typical Holiday Inn.”
Reviews.Author: ifand
Reviews.Content: Stayed in "exec" room. Huge, very comfortable bed but as usual in Holiday Inns little or no adjustment of air con which is preset by hotel. Didn't eat in hotel but did use an excellent little restaurant within easy walking distance (near the bus stop) No problems with staff that others seemed to experience. Actually found them quite helpful. However they do get a lot of coach parties and perhaps can get a bit "impatient" or "tetchy" with them. Having seen the way that some customers speak to receptionists and other staff members I can possibly forgive them this. There is a regular shuttle (payable) that will take you to the bus/train station in Venice. This is the main drop off point. The shuttle has to be booked as a return trip and is approx 8 euros. It was convenient but the regular bus service was more flexible timewise although demande a walk of about half a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a place that is within easy reach of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Chander_62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for our short stay. The hotel is accessible from the airport by no 15 bus which would cost around 3 euros. The nearest stop is just past Hotel Roma in Magehra. No 6 bus would take you to Venice from the bus stop which is also about 5 minutes walk at the back of the hotel. The room was excellent and the bathroom clean & tidy. Our room was at the end of the corridor which can be noisy from the generator or the cooling units.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel 20 min from all sights”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel with good staff and ok rooms. My TV was outdated and decor boring but bed and everything else were good. Bathroom was great. Alfredo at the Front Desk was super helpful and friendly. I haven't tried restaurant. I didn't like that hotel charged for internet, didn't have adapter for the 110V and one of its public phones wasn't working. Marghera district is about 20 min drive from the tourist area in Venice. I didn't rent a car, so I took a bus there every day. Make sure you check the schedule of night buses. The bus stop is about 10 min walk from hotel. I felt safe walking around at night. There are even few pizza places in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Useful cheap-ish option for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Traedmawr
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is not too good, but there are several options for getting into Venice "proper". We took the hotel bus, which cost 7 euros return. If you wander away from the hotel towards the quiet residential area nearby, there are several homely eating options available at excellent prices. Several reviews mention rude staff etc. We'd like to emphasise that, contrary to the impression given by those reviews, we found that the opposite was true; the staff on the desk, and the restaurant staff especially, and the driver, were very helpful and polite at all times. If you want to be at the "heart of Venice", to step out from your olde-worldy hotel onto a beautiful square, then this hotel is definitely not for you. If however you want good value, and are willing to walk and take public transport, this is a good option; or perhaps do as we did, spend some cheap time here, and then "splurge" for one night at a more up-market central hotel for part of the stay. The one negative which applies to the Holiday Inn group is the highly annoying additional cost of WiFI access. Please HI, stop charging directly for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.. noisy, unhelpful staff, old tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sumthin2020
Reviews.Content: Staff were grim faced and unhelpful almost rude. Was given a room with 3 single beds even though we were clearly a couple. Room we changed to was small and very noisy practically on the motorway with cars and bikes making noise all night. In the morning people slamming doors and shouting in halls from about 6am. Room was also not very clean the shower head was covered in mould and the toilet seat cracked wide open. How how can it be to have some new plastic toilet seats available in a hotel? An empty cupboard in the room that said mini bar so no fridge and when I asked if they had an ice machine was looked at like I was an alien and told to make a complaint and maybe they will get one if they have enough complaints! Then the directions to the bus stop to get to Venice we terrible and not clear and its a fair walk to the bus stop. No pool no free wifi and you have to pay more for parking. How on earth this can be a 4 star hotel is beyond me!!.... I have stayed at 100s of Hotels worldwide and this is barely 2 star standard. There are far better hotel in Mestre avoid this one until they completely refurbish and retrain staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: StephanieZolt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel which was about 10 minutes from the downtown Venice area. One of the really nice things about the hotel was the shuttle service to get to the downtown area. The shuttle costs 7euro per person round trip. Sign up for what times you want to go and return at the front desk because there are limited spaces. The shuttle drops you off at the main bus station in Venice, at the beginning of all the canals. There, you can get a ticket for a bus/train (airport or other locations) or can also purchase tickets for the water public transportation. A one trip ticket costs 6,50 euro but from our experience, the tickets are free at nighttime. The hotel was very clean, friendly staff, came with a bar for the late night drinks and also serves a great breakfast with fruit, toast, eggs (although they were a little shady), sausage, yogurt, coffee, tea, juice, etc. It also included some of the typical Italian breakfasts with a variety of cheese, prosciutto, and other fruits. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We took the public bus to the airport from our hotel to save approximately 30euro for a taxi ride. The bus station is a 7 minute walk from the hotel and cost 3,70euro to get to the airport with about a 30-40 minute ride through the town which was pretty nice, actually. When I return to Venice, I will definitely look up this hotel! Review of costs: Hotel to downtown Venice and back (with shuttle) - 7,00 per person Waterbuses in Venice - 6,50 per person one way Hotel to VCE airport via Taxi - 30,00 Hotel to VCE airport via Bus - 3,70 Train station tickets - 18,50 Gondola ride downtown Venice - 80,00 - 100,00

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Nice”
Reviews.Author: BobbyDayal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the outskirts of Venice. Although a bit hard to find. 5 minutes from the Mestre train station and about 5 minutes walk to the closest bus stop( Bus goes directly to Piazale Roma). Was attended very well. Floor Manager named Mr.Franco was very helpfull. Had breakfast which was not too bad.Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Service was not as expected from an Holiday inn group hotel”
Reviews.Author: deepak41
Reviews.Content: Located away from the main tourist area. The rooms were quite good and spacious. Staff was not at all polite. Receptionist behaved as if she was too busy and seemed to be puzzled all the time. Breakfast was simple. Overall it was not a satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for venice”
Reviews.Author: gliss
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay. We are not big breakfast people. Tthere is a petrol station shop 1min from hotel, ideal to buy coffee and pastry in the morning, just like the locals do. We did arrange breakfast for our last day.......but we could not sit down because they had to check the booking first. Took them 30 mins to sort this out! Laughable. Avoid the hotel minibus ride 14euros return. 10 min pleasant walk to the bus stop. Bus takes you direct to Venice bus station (30 mins from leaving hotel) for a fraction of the price. Purchase all in travel ticket on your first day, it covers you for all buses and boat rides in Venice. Excellent base to explore Venice but also see a bit of Italy besides. Mestre is where most of those who work in Venice live, commuter belt. The town square in Mestre is worth a visit too.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Davep_9
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was not sure what to expect, but having stayed for four nights I must be honest an say the place was perfect. For the price you pay I can't see how you could get better value in this part of Italy. The bedrooms are nicely decorated and the breakfast is very good with the choice of a hot option( eggs & bacon ). There is a shuttle from the airport to Venice which I think cost 7 euro's but about two blocks behind the hotel is a bus stop where you can catch a number 6 bus fo 1 euro 10 cents to the bus station in Venice. On the walk to the bus stop are two very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, no problems and enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: cottowner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice over the course of 10 days, both times, check in and out was easy and the cot we requested was in the room and everything was as it should be. Found the reception staff to be curtious, helpful and polite. Arrived and departed via taxi from Marco Polo airport, cost 55 Euro's there and 46 Euro's to go back, could have taken a no 15 bus which had a stop that was quite close to the hotel, but decided against it. +/- 15 TV channels, but only CNN in english. Room was very clean and met our needs fine. Breakfast was 11 euro's each, but with a great selection and kids eating free it was well worth it, filled us up for a days sightseeing. Dinner looked pricey, so we never ate at the hotel, prefering to look for the pizzeria (Pizerria - Restorante Al Calesse) mentioned in previous reviews which we though was excellent value, especially in Venice (36 Euro's for two huge pizza's, a bottle of wine, a soft drink and a dessert). Never took the Holiday Inn bus to Venice (7 or 8 Euro's pppd) instead deciding to take the no 6 bus. Bus was crowded and found taking small child, 3 large bags and a suitcase to and from the cruise terminal a struggle, but managed. Directions for getting to Pizzaria, No6 and No15 bus - Go out front of reception and turn left to go round back of hotel and exit via the green gate. Turn left and walk up until reaching a T Junction (5 mins). Pizzeria is on the left at junction, it looks like it is shut with curtains in the window, as we wern't sure, but it was open. Cross to the other side of the road and turn left, walk towards the roundabout, no15 bus stop is just along this road. On reaching the roundabout turn right and no 6 bus stop is just up a bit. Cheaper tickets for the bus can be bought from the tobbaconist at the roundabout, but we always bought on the bus as they were only 1.80 anyway on the bus. In summation, I have to say how glad I was to be staying here, just a 15 minute bus ride (every 20 minutes) away from Venice rather than paying 3 times the price to stay on the island. Like myself I am sure many of the tourists staying off the island were having a chuckle at people struggling to carry their luggage for quite some distance over many bridges and through crowded streets to find their hotel due to the lack of accessability.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, good for avoiding ridiculous city prices in Venice, but the worst service”
Reviews.Author: mehemehem
Reviews.Content: I'm American... and apparently this means I have been spoiled my whole life by what I thought was normal service, and what most others consider superior and first class treatment. We were delayed by an airline strike for 2 nights in Venice, and the airline put us at this hotel, so I won't complain about quality in general. If I was looking for a budget hotel not on the island of Venice but to commute daily for the sites, it is probably well worth it. They have a shuttle for 8 euro a person all day long that can take you right into the city, and looking back if we hadn't gotten such a good deal on our city-hotel, this would have been a good alternative. But at every instance the men and women working for the hotel at the counter were at best clueless and unhelpful, and in the worst case, a women who may have been a manager, was downright rude. I'm not picky about these things too much now that I have lived in the UK for almost 2 years and have become accustomed to being ignored by service providers for hours on end while I want to do nothing more than pay for my coffee, but shrill, abrupt and almost angry rudeness is above the line, especially when it's your job it be literally hospitable. The same lack of concern extended to most of the rest of the staff including a bartender that was so clueless I actually felt sorry for her. But then again... apparently I'm used to higher standards. If you don't mind these things, which many don't, it's a decent hotel, and the beds are extremely comfortable. Bring your own amenities as all they have in the bathroom is a 'cream wash" but the rooms are nice, comfortable and clean. Normally we never eat in hotels for breakfast because they are usually rip-offs, but ours was included in what the airline paid for, and I would in fact pay that myself for what we got. How is it that a hotel that wont put in bottles of shampoo or conditioner will provide fantastic salami, an array of cheeses and cold meats of decent-to-superior quality, fresh melons and other fruits, fresh scrambled eggs, which were fantastic, fried eggs, tons of bacon, sausage, and all the trimmings? I could have happily eaten there for lunch as well. Moral of the story: eat a huge breakfast, avoid the staff, and this may be a really good way to avoid paying twice as much for a tiny room on the outskirts of the islands where it would take you just as long to walk to the sights as the bus ride from this hotel. It's also about 15 minutes from the airport and 35 euro flat fare for the cab ride, which seems a lot until you realize it's 25 euro round trip per person on the vaporetto from the islands and that take, I am not joking, 1.5 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ivalmas
Reviews.Content: A typical holiday inn hotel. Nice rooms and clean environment

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from Grand Canal area - reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: njoyurkidz
Reviews.Content: Staff left a lot to be desired. Rooms were adequate: clean but VERY small especially for a family w/ 2 young teens. We actually had to get 2 rooms to accomodate us. Taxis are Very pricey from hotel. If traveling on a budget with kids it is a good option - as affordable options which accomodate families are a bit difficult to locate - that is the only reason I recommend it. It is fine. Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but rude”
Reviews.Author: Bedrule
Reviews.Content: A very clean property, but a bit stark and lots of wear and tear.The downer here is the attitude of the staff throughout. Very curt and dismissive and not at all helpful for any guidance. Breakfast @ 11.00eur/pp is over the top for a luke warm buffet. The Shell tation across the street is better. The dining room for dinner is stark and looks as if a seniors home. Very uninviting. The pitzerria 4 blk walk is superb!! The bar has virtually no service and the internet available is a rip...even in your room, 8.00eur for 15min. As we said, clean but be aware! Good shuttle service to Venice @ 7.00eur/pp but pre book.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern and spacious rooms but oh dear-terrible food and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: TrulyDorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights as part of a tour group. The rooms were large, modern and well appointed as was the rest of the hotel. However, the bar was hardly ever staffed and you had to go looking for someone to help you. One night, upon seeing the barman in the reception, my husband told him that he had customers waiting. The barman's response was "They will have to learn to wait". The manager was standing right behind him at the time and never made any comment. Whether it was because we were part of a tour, I don't know but the food was abysmal. Not at all what we were expecting on our first visit to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GurgaonBased
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in Sept 2009. It was a great stay and I would recommend everyone to stay in this hotel. My reasons are as follows: 1. the main city of Venice does not have any taxis or buses or even cars. All public transportation ends at the main bus/ train station and you have to take the water taxi from there to your hotel. These are VERY VERY expensive. A private one could casily cost upwards of EUR 60 for 2 persons with 2 suitcases and the public one is so full that you wont get place even to stand [and it still costs EUR 6.5 per person one way]. So if your hotel is in the main city, you will need to take a watertaxi to some where close to the hotel and then lug the suitcase around and find the hotel on foot. Its not simple when you realise that the street numbers etc are missing/ difficult to find! So it is preferable to stay outside the main city so that you can easily reach by bus or cab. 2. This hotel is pretty well connected by bus and cab. We came from Switzerland and came to the Mestre railway station [one stop before the main railway station] and rang up the hotel to ask for directions. The english speaking person who answered the phone, advised us to buy bus tickets to the bus stop near the hotel from where it was 10 min walk. The cost was EUR 1.1 per person. 3. We never took the hotel's coach to the city. the bus stop was just a 10 min walk away and return tickets were available at the tobacco shop at the bus stand. 4.The hotel itself seems to be a 3 star hotel. The staff was OK.... not very forthcoming but was helpful enough and gave the correct directions etc. Probably it was a language thing. 5. The rooms were fine/ clean/ large/ airconditioned with an electronic safe and the breakfast was also a reasonably large spread. However they impose the rule about not taking anything from the breakfast table with you for eating later [not even an apple]. 6. Since you are staying outside the main city, the cost is also much lower. I think our stay cost about EUR 180 for 2 persons for 2 nights. Booked on the Holiday inn site. I think it was a great deal. You spend much lower on the hotel and travel to the city is just 30 min away [including time spent in walking to the bus stop] @ EUR 2.2 for a return ticket. 7. Because of some shopping, we took the cab back to the Mestre railway station. It cost us EUR 14 during peak hours [9 AM]

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Hotel Outside of the City”
Reviews.Author: msm
Reviews.Content: Convenient to public transportation to commute to/from Venice, the Holiday Inn has clean, spacious and modern rooms. We only stayed one night after a 12 day cruise. We were disappointed that the hotel's shuttle bus was booked from 9am (when we arrived) to the mid-afternoon. We couldn't wait 6 hours or we would have lost most of our tour time. The staff told us how to take the public bus to Venice. We don't speak Italian but managed to get to Venice easily. It didn't go as well on the way home. We couldn't find the right stop on the way home and bus drivers weren't able to help us. We finally rode back to Venice on the bus and got a cab. We didn't use hotel facilities such as restaurants so can't speak to those. The hotel is only a 25 Euro cab ride from the cruise ship port, much cheaper than most cruise shuttle prices. There is a gas station right next to the hotel. You can buy a limited number of snack items there. Many people have commented on staff rudeness but the front desk was very helpful to us. If you take a cab to the airport, set the fare in advance. We think we got cheated by a cab driver who didn't turn on the meter. All in all, we would definitely stay again if we didn't want to stay in Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “Staff will not answer your requests at all”
Reviews.Author: xuxiake
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in early September. When I ask "when is the first bus to the train station," the staff member told me the bus next time. I repeated my question and he got extremely impatient. He finally said I should add "in the morning" in my sentence and claimed that all the miscommunication is due to my fault. I also made several other requests and none got answered. When they answer your questions, they retreat you like prisoners. They charge you 15 euro a day for the Internet as some European hotels. What is funny is they even do not provide free Internet in the pubic area. The location is very bad. You need to walk 20 minutes to the bus stop. The bus goes to Venice Santa Lucia, not Mestre. The room is small. Except the bed and walkway, there is virtually no space. Unfortunately, I need to re-check in tomorrow. Hope they can change.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ANNESOT
Reviews.Content: Clean, bright, friendly ( apart from shuttle bus driver - but he got us to and from Venice in quick time). Brilliant buffet breakfast. Hotel is 15 mins from main Venice bus station by road but we used the hotel shuttle bus service which cost 7 euros each per round trip. Advisable to book this the night before.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of Venice, would use again”
Reviews.Author: jinxscotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn to visit Venice. The hotel and rooms are what you would expect, spacious, clean, modern and with lovely comfy beds. The upsides, the beds :) 24 hour service, the polite bar and breakfast staff, the buffet breakfast has everything from bacon & eggs to fruit, pastries etc. The downsides, the breakfast buffet is â‚¬11 each! And drinks/coffees are very expensive although you can get them day or night. We ate in the hotel one night and were not impressed at all, expensive and not tasty. Our room key didnt work on a couple of occassions and the cleaner couldnt get her master key to work to our amusement! As with another reviewer we were met with some disbelieft that our card would not work... The hotel obviously wishes to push its â‚¬7 transfer to the centre of Venice, however, if you ask they will give you a map with directions to take the number 6 bus from a couple of streets away. Cost â‚¬1 per person each way. (although as someone mentioned, noone checks tickets) The hotel charged us twice for our breakfasts, though quickly corrected this when asked so make sure you check!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoverHouston
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms in this hotel were spacious and the beds were great. Nice large king size beds. It is outside Venice, but it was perfect for us as we drove into Venice and wanted to commute to Venice. Frankly after crowded Venice, this was nice and peaceful. The bus ride is very comfortable and cheap. Did not use the hotel shuttle as it was both expensive and cumbersome booking etc. The hotel staff could have told us that we would have to buy the bus tickets before we boarded the bus to get the 1.10Euro per ticket. We got onto the bus and found out that it was 1.80Euro per ticket after we board the bus. The walk to the busstop from the hotel is beautiful. Nice small town ambience. The public places in the hotels were awful. The lobby smelt of unwashed bathroom. We just ran to our rooms which was really nice and clean thank god. The restaurant, didn't have anything much and they didn't even have milk at 10 am in the morning in room service. But overall I was happy with the room and what we got for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to say but far off from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: anuban1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the out skirts of the city. is on just 15 mins drive from Piazza Le Roma (the main bus station of Venice) & Venice Mestre Train Station. The restaurant serves lavish breakfast and delicious lunch/dinner. the only problem was, they dint write the names or any description of the preparations in the buffet lunch. it becomes a problem for people like me who do not eat beef/pork to check as to whats on the shelf. being a star rated hotel, they should display as to what are the ingredients used in the dish. nor the staff was aware of these things. :( rooms are quite comfortable and clean. staff is friendly. a shuttle service is available to and fro Piazza le Roma through out the day. charge is 7 Euro both side. a small shop is there nearby on the gas station, where you can get things for your daily needs eg ciggarettes, chips, buns and burgers etc. price of the room was cheaper as compared to some hotels in the main city, but my sugggestion is not to look out for money. do not stay so far off from the main attractions, it ends up the excitement :(

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but Far”
Reviews.Author: GAwalker
Reviews.Content: We got to Mestre by Train on a Sunday and tried to follow the directions given by the hotel. The hotel was difficult to find as we were not given clear directions as to which bus stop we should go to in order to take the bus from the train station. The worst part is that on a weekend we could not buy tickets to ride the bus as all the Tobbacco shops and newspaper stands were closed - worst is that we could not even find Taxis either. After some walking we finally found the correct bus stop. We tried paying for the bus fare directly to the driver, but he basically just ignored us - We essentially got a free ride. After getting off at the stop indicated by the hotel we were basically in the middle of a residential area with a few stores, but they were all closed b/c of the weekend. The walk is actually far specially if you have luggage. The hotel was clean and it was basically a standard Holiday Inn. Like the previous reviewer mentioned, the hotel is far from Venice and the only easy way to get to Venice is by Shuttle that will cost you 7EU round trip per person. In comparison, a train ride only cost 2EU round trip per person from Mestre to Venice. You can potentially take a bus, but the bus stop is quite far from the hotel. The breakfast menu is decent, but will set you back 11EU per person - for the breakfast buffet. Did not have any other meal at the hotel so I can't comment on the rest. The hotel staff gave contradicting answers regarding how to go to the airport. The first person told us to take the bus, but after I walked to the bus stop (different from the one that we arrived) I quickly realized that this is not an option for us w/ luggage. The second person told us to just take a taxi and that it should not cost more than 25EU. On the day that we left I asked front desk to call me a taxi, which they promptly did. When I tried to confirm that it should only cost me 25EU to the airport he gave me a puzzled look and said that it should be about 35EU w/ no traffic. It ended up costing us about 40EU (b/c of baggage fee 1EU per bag).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAK
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Venice where we stayed at the Holiday Inn at Mestre - perhaps it was our fault, but the hotel was actually five kilometres from Mestre. There was a shuttle bus available with a round trip charge of 7 euros per person. We were disappointed that we couldn't book one way only. The bus was never full ( surely a one way charge would have been better than the bus being left idle). We ended up using the local transport - the cost of which was included with the vaporetto ticket. Apart from that , we found the hotel clean and comfortable with very friendly staff who couldn't do enough for us. The breakfast selection was good. We can't comment on the evening menu as we always ate out during the day. As long as you don't mind the walk to the bus stop then this is a good hotel to stay at. We would recommend the purchase of a transport pass as this also includes the bus to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel in Decline”
Reviews.Author: Copyrightguilt
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel about five years ago for business and, had I known of Tripadvisor then, would have given it a solid review. Now however, it is barely more attractive than 1970â€™s student digs. The room was grubby, in need of redecoration and refitting. A restaurant with menu shorter than a schoolâ€™s lunch choice, slow service then food from a factory canteen really finished this hotel off for us. The decent snack, for a late lunch, in the hotel bar and the pleasantly efficient waitress does little to warrant using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_in_Toledo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little ways from the city. We only stayed here one night and the only negative was the location of the hotel. We walked about 10 minutes to catch a city bus. The person at the front desk sold us tickets for the bus and gave us directions. They were very helpful. Although the walk wasn't through the best of neighborhoods, we stayed in a group and no one bothered us. The bus took us right to the city and back. The rooms at the hotel were fine and the breakfast that was included was fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Julie6802
Reviews.Content: Was not quite sure what to expect after reading the mixed reviews but we were pleasantly surprised! and loved staying at this hotel. We arrived at the hotel by bus from the airport (Trevasso airport), it took us about 1h15. We were quite surprised to find this hotel located in a very residential, calm and safe neighborhood. Staff at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful. The room was very nice and clean, better than expected after reading the reviews. The hotel is located 20 minutes from Venise with very easy access. The first day, we took the hotel shuttle which was very convenient (7 euros round trip). The next day, we took the local bus which was a lot cheaper and also convenient. The bus stop is located approx 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. We had breakfast at the gaz station every morning, croissant, freashly squeezed orange juice and expresso coffee for decent price. We loved the local restaurants around the hotel . We tried 2 of the local restaurants and absolutely loved the food. The food was a lot better and cheaper than in Venise and we enjoyed eating with the locals. There is an ice cream store 5 minutes from the hotel, which was excellent. Taxi to Marco Polo airport was 40 euros, little expensive. Would definitely return to this hotel, we liked staying in a quiet place and be in a residential area after spending all day in Venise.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find.....”
Reviews.Author: Travelingmo
Reviews.Content: This was a typical Holiday Inn, but the location is very difficult to find. The map I printed out from the internet site listed the wrong buses to take. And, once you got off the bus, the walk was very confusing and long. If you stay here----make sure you take a cab from the train station or Venice. Once you have done the bus, it is ok. We stayed here after a cruise. I would advise taking a cab from the Roma plaza where the cruise transfer drops you. Then, after the hotel gives you a map, you can take the bus back into Venice, and back again. The restaurant and bar were over the top pricey---go to the gas station next door for a coke! They arranged an airport transfer for us then next morning that was reasonably priced and very convenient. They stored our luggage for us for the day, although the bellmad was surly about getting back into the conference/storage room to get something out of my suitcase.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Venice Mestre Marghera
HotelInfo.Address: Rotonda Romea 1/2, 30175 Venice, Italy
